question: During which holiday weekend in 2016 did Disney Channel air a marathon of older Disney Channel Original Movies to celebrate its 100th film?

content: Question: During which holiday weekend in 2016 did Disney Channel air a marathon of older Disney Channel Original Movies to celebrate its 100th film?

<python>
results = search_pages("Disney Channel Original Movies 100th film 2016")
if results:
    page_id = results[0]['page_id']
    sections = view_sections(page_id)
    for section in sections:
        section_id = section['section_id']
        content = read_section(section_id)
        if "holiday weekend" in content or "2016" in content:
            print(content)
            break
</python>

<python_output>
# List of Disney Channel original films

*Revision ID: 1160299053 | Timestamp: 2023-06-15T15:44:07Z*

---

Many [film](television)(television film)s have been produced for [Channel](Disney)(Disney Channel), an American family-oriented basic [channel](cable)(cable television) and former [premium](pay television) [channel](television)(television channel) since its launch on April 18, 1983. Until October 1997, films were released under the banner name of **Disney Channel Premiere Films**; since then, the films are currently released under the **Disney Channel Original Movie** (**DCOM**) banner.

Most of these films were subsequently released on [VHS](VHS), [DVD](DVD-Video), or, more recently, [Blu-ray](Blu-ray). However, many more entries in the Disney Channel film library were never released in any home video format. Originally, the films were released on DVD months after their Disney Channel premieres, but beginning with *[Protection Program](Princess)(Princess Protection Program)* in 2009, DVDs for DCOMs have been released one week after their television premieres. Also, although DCOMs have been produced in widescreen HD format since mid-2005, the 2009 release of *[Protection Program](Princess)(Princess Protection Program)* became the first DCOM to appear in widescreen DVD viewing format.

The highest-rated premiere for the banner/brand came in August 2007, when *[School Musical 2](High)(High School Musical 2)* set a record for basic cable with 17.2 million viewers. The second highest-rated premiere is held by *[of Waverly Place: The Movie](Wizards)(Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie)*, which premiered with 11.4 million viewers. Other major DCOM franchises include *[Halloweentown](Halloweentown (film series))*, *[Zenon](Zenon: Girl of the 21st Century (film))*, *[Twitches](Twitches (film))*, *[Cheetah Girls](The)(The Cheetah Girls (franchise))*, *[Rock](Camp)(Camp Rock)*, *[Beach](Teen)(Teen Beach Movie)*, *[Descendants](Descendants (franchise))*, and *[Zombies](Zombies (franchise))*.

During the [Day](Memorial)(Memorial Day) holiday weekend of 2016, Disney Channel began to air many older DCOMs in a specialized [marathon](Marathon (media)) [block](programming)(Block programming) in celebration of its 100th film, *[in Babysitting](Adventures)(Adventures in Babysitting (2016 film))*. Disney Channel broadcast all previous 99 Disney Channel Original Movies that came before it, beginning with the 51 most popular films airing over the four-day weekend, beginning May 27, 2016 and continuing throughout the following month until the June 24 premiere of the aforementioned 100th Disney Channel Original Movie.
